About GM

There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

**Please note that interviews with the hiring manager will not take place until after Labor Day (there are other steps however, that will be scheduled and completed prior to that)* *

Responsibilities:

As a Manufacturing Engineering Intern, you will rotate through a series of positions and assignments in plant and corporate staff locations throughout the United States sought to cultivate development and to educate. These positions are hands-on and engaging. You will learn problem solving on the fly, to work collaboratively with many members of the team, and be able to flex your creative muscles. Most assignments will be located in Warren, MI or Vehicle Assembly Plants in MI. Examples of Manufacturing Engineering assignments available include:

  • Programming of manufacturing technology
  • Analyze product, process and technology to craft best methods to paint & assemble vehicles, and protect the manufacturing process
  • Recommend and validate improvement for existing processes
  • Develop tools to improve program/project management
  • Support development of cybersecurity tools for manufacturing
  • Assists in the design and building of tools and equipment
  • Assists maintenance personnel in operation and maintenance of specialized equipment
  • Troubleshoots special maintenance and equipment problems
  • Coordinates machinery upgrade projects

About Global Manufacturing Engineering Vehicle Systems Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for all value-added systems from exit of Body Shop through shipping of finished vehicle
  • Develop & Validate new Manufacturing Technologies and BOE for Automation, Paint, and General Assembly Shops
  • Develop Processes, Machine & Equipment and Tools for 50+ Assembly Plants, 40+ Stamping Plants, and approximately 30 launches each year globally
  • Develop, Validate, and Maintain Common Conveyance Systems and Controls
  • Develop, Validate, and Maintain Cybersecurity Technology to create a secure factory
  • Teams work collaboratively with other centers to reduce energy and waste globally.

Job locations can be at Manufacturing Engineering headquarters in Warren, Michigan or in various plant locations throughout the U.S. Plant locations may include:

  • Warren, MI
  • Flint, MI
  • Lansing, MI
  • Orion, MI
  • Milford, MI
  • Fort Wayne, IN
  • Arlington, TX
  • Bowling Green, KY
  • Spring Hill, TN
  • Wentzville, MO
  • Fairfax, KS
  • Parma, OH

Some travel may be required.

Additional Job Description

Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology, Computer Engineering or Computer Science
  • Able to work fulltime, 40 hours per week

Desired Skills:

  • Knowledge of statistical methods as applied to experimental design and process development
  • Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization as needed
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience
  • Emerging partnership and collaboration skills and ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment
  • High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, take initiative/self-directed
  • Evidence of strong character with integrity, honesty, accountability and trust
  • Consistently demonstrates innovative thinking that is customer-centric

Facebook Reality Labs is looking for interns to advance our pioneering work in neuromotor interfaces , which has grown out of the acquisition of CTRL-labs. This technology could become one of the main pillars for interaction with the virtual and augmented world. Help us unleash human potential by erasing the bottlenecks between user intent and action. In this role you will embed with a world-class, multi-disciplinary team of researchers to investigate the nature of human neuromotor signals (EMG), develop novel signal processing and machine learning methods to infer a user’s intent, and create novel interaction techniques and user experiences.Our internships are twelve (12) to twenty four (24) weeks long, and we have various start dates throughout the year.
  • Plan and execute cutting-edge applied research to advance neuromotor interface capabilities.
  • Collaborate with engineering and Human-Computer Interactions (HCI) teams to translate fundamental scientific knowledge into new technology and user experiences.
  • Use quantitative research methods to define, iterate upon and advance key areas of our research agenda.
  • Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
  • Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a PhD, in [one or more of the following fields:] systems neuroscience, computational neuroscience, machine learning, biophysics, physics, electrical engineering, computer science, statistics, or related fields.
  • Strong research-oriented implementation skills, including fluency in scientific Python and PyTorch.
  • Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
  • Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship.
  • Familiarity with scientific communication tools (jupyter, matplotlib).
  • Experience in software engineering in industry.
  • Experience in signal processing and familiarity with real-time signals.
  • Experience working with neural data or other physiological signals.

STAR Lab's Tech Team is responsible for the integral development of core technology and the science behind NEON. We are passionate about researching and building the future generation of products and services to be used by millions of people.

As an Intern in Computer Graphics, you will be a part of the R&D team. You will be collaborating within the team across product, design, infrastructure, strategy and engineering. About Houston-Galveston Area Council

The Houston-Galveston Area Council is one of the largest regional planning commissions in the country with a diverse service area of 13 counties and more than 7 million people. We are the pulse of our region addressing issues that cross city limits and county lines every single day.
We make decisions that affect our transportation system, ensure the safety and well-being or our seniors, connect people to jobs, help families recover from natural disasters, preserve water quality for our children, and so much more. We work to make the region a great place to live, work, and thrive.

Kelly Services is seeking a Machine Learning Intern for one of our top clients in Lincolnshire, IL.

We seek candidates who have the skills and research experience to join a new team to push the boundaries of pure mathematics, theoretical statistics (incl. parametric and non-parametric Bayesian statistics) and machine learning (primarily in deep reinforcement learning). A proven record of publications (at least one first-author paper in reputed conferences such as NeurIPS, COLT, UAI, ICML, AISTATS, JMLR, PAMI, and others) and prototyping skills in terms of developing algorithms, in any language, is critical.


As an industry R&D laboratory, we pursue theoretical and applied research to feed into the other. Like academia, knowledge dissemination is through the publication of papers in reputed journals, conferences and workshops, and patents. We have current collaborations with world-renowned academic institutions; encouraging such industry-academia partnerships is important for research scientists.


Qualifications, skills and other information:


  • Internship applicants will generally study towards a PhD degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, and allied disciplines. (core requirement)
  • Knowledge of reinforcement learning (essential) and multi-agent systems (desirable)
  • Knowledge of Bayesian statistics (desirable)
  • Hands-on experience with at least one of the following: Python, C/C++, Java, etc. (core requirement)
  • REQUIRED: Concrete experience in reinforcement learning that goes beyond downloading an RL codebase and running it.
  • Data science and 'concrete' experience in RL are very different – the latter requires prowess both in mathematics and computer science, REQUIRED for this role. This difference is paramount. Someone who just has ML and Python on their CVs do not qualify them for RL.
  • Good candidates may have (a) published in the field of RL in top conferences i.e., original contribution, or (b) have a codebase that is original in GitHub/Bitbucket.

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems. At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers. The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen. ' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance. ' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022. ' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area. ' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

- Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level. - Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays. - Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs. - Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket. - Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed. - Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.

How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021. Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt. Applicant packages should include: ' Resume, ' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests, ' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and ' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted). Early Acceptance Incentive; The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period. If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail summerinterns@uwe.nsa.gov for application questions. ***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

  • Work Location: 100% Remote

Requirements:

  • A passion for our mission!

  • Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

  • Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

  • Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

  • Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

  • Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Data Science & Insights team provides actionable information that drives decision-making across the enterprise through statistical modeling and comprehensive data storytelling. They are also tasked with working across all of ALSAC to ensure analysts and business users have the tools, knowledge, and access to the data needed to make strategic decisions in their respective areas. Intern projects and tasks will range from helping build and improve existing data models that ALSAC leadership and decision makers consume to developing data visualizations, reports, and dashboards that synthesize large amounts of data using Tableau. Intern will also assist with documenting certified business processes and data sources using the Alation Data Catalog. The successful candidate may assist with project management, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, and report automation. Intern will take part in supporting the data science & insights team on individual projects that support overall decision making. Intern will document work procedures, processes, and methodologies for future use. Intern will also work closely with the Sr Data Analytics Liaison to create customized learning plan that focuses on his/her areas of interest.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interacting with business partners and ALSAC leadership to gather, interpret, and document requirements for various requests for analytical support

  • Working with Data Scientists to learn and understand the value of statistical models using Data Robot

  • Providing recommendations for process improvements regarding data analysis and research

  • Working with Data & Analytics Enablement team to create reports that simplify technical terms and processes using the Alation Data Catalog

  • Collaborating with Data Governance to assist in the decision making process around new data requests

  • Brainstorming and providing feedback on enterprise-wide Data Literacy efforts

  • Other duties as assigned

Majors preferred: Business Administration, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science

Technical Skills Preferred: SQL, Tableau, Machine Learning, Microsoft Office

Non-Technical Skills Preferred: Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, CURIOSITY.

Application & Interview Process:

After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

For more information, visit stjude.org/alsacintern

  • Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • May require early morning or late night meetings to coordinate work assignments with our worldwide geographical development team.

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

We’re looking for someone in the midst of completing their Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python
  • Knowledge/Experience using web services: Spark, S3, RedShift, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL
  • Knowledge/Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Neo4J, Neptune, Cassandra, HBase and associated languages (Cypher, Gremlin)

Our projects and research deeply explore multidisciplinary problems in engineering, architecture, computer science, simulation, and design. Projects we are developing involve machine learning, computer vision, generative design, robotics, cloud computing, time series databases, sensor networks, big data navigation, and simulation.

The User Research Internship is a part-time, 6 month program that supports the academic growth of students enrolled in a college/university with an interest in the User Experience field, with the potential for full-time hire after graduation. Interns will gain practical, hands-on experience in various research methodologies, with a focus on survey creation, interviewing, usability testing, and screening/recruiting participants. Interns will work remotely for 20-25 hours per week on a set (but flexible) schedule.

Job Responsibilities

I. Prepare, Conduct, Analyze Research

  • Create surveys using Alchemer

  • Run usability tests and interview clients on the zoom/in person

  • Analyze quantitative and qualitative research

  • Prepare research readouts/decks that effectively communicate research findings to stakeholders

II. Recruit Research Participants

  • Work with User Researchers to determine target-user traits/criteria

  • Create screeners to ensure participants meet the criteria

  • Pull lists of clients who qualify for research

  • Use Ethn.io tool to schedule the research meetings, most of which happen via Zoom

  • Schedule and invite team members to research sessions using Outlook

  • Compensate clients who have participated in a research study via our gift card platform

III. Support the User Research Team

  • Take detailed notes during research sessions and brainstorm meetings

  • Contact clients via email and phone to book research sessions in person or remotely

  • Support the workload of User Researchers & Recruiters as needed

Desired Research Experience

  • Experience conducting research in the social sciences or humanities

  • Experience analyzing/coding qualitative and/or quantitative data

  • Experience interviewing research participants

  • Experience building rapport with research participants

We’re looking for you to…

  • Be excited about User Experience Research and a drive to learn about the broader UX field

  • Be outgoing and very comfortable talking to clients on the phone/interviewing them

  • Be incredibly organized and capable of juggling multiple projects at the same time

  • Be self-driven, finding innovative ways to help the team when there is lull in your task load

  • Fully own research projects from start to finish, while keeping manager up-to-date on their status

  • Be proficient in Google Docs and Spreadsheets


Education

Be currently enrolled in a college/university, preferably in a UX or Research-related program (Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, Industrial Design)

• Currently enrolled in an Associate’s, Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
In addition to Computer Science and Computer Engineering, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or majors relating to these fields are considered

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security – just to name a few.

We seek candidates who have the skills and research experience to join a new team to push the boundaries of pure mathematics, theoretical statistics (incl. parametric and non-parametric Bayesian statistics) and machine learning (primarily in deep reinforcement learning). A proven record of publications (at least one first-author paper in reputed conferences such as NeurIPS, COLT, UAI, ICML, AISTATS, JMLR, PAMI, and others) and prototyping skills in terms of developing algorithms, in any language, is critical.


As an industry R&D laboratory, we pursue theoretical and applied research to feed into the other. Like academia, knowledge dissemination is through the publication of papers in reputed journals, conferences and workshops, and patents. We have current collaborations with world-renowned academic institutions; encouraging such industry-academia partnerships is important for research scientists.


Qualifications, skills and other information:


  • Internship applicants will generally study towards a PhD degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, and allied disciplines. (core requirement)
  • Knowledge of reinforcement learning (essential) and multi-agent systems (desirable)
  • Knowledge of Bayesian statistics (desirable)
  • Hands-on experience with at least one of the following: Python, C/C++, Java, etc. (core requirement)
  • REQUIRED: Concrete experience in reinforcement learning that goes beyond downloading an RL codebase and running it.
  • Data science and 'concrete' experience in RL are very different – the latter requires prowess both in mathematics and computer science, REQUIRED for this role. This difference is paramount. Someone who just has ML and Python on their CVs do not qualify them for RL.
  • Good candidates may have (a) published in the field of RL in top conferences i.e., original contribution, or (b) have a codebase that is original in GitHub/Bitbucket.

The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems. At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers. The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen. ' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance. ' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022. ' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area. ' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

- Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level. - Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays. - Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs. - Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket. - Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed. - Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.

How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021. Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt. Applicant packages should include: ' Resume, ' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests, ' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and ' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted). Early Acceptance Incentive; The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period. If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail summerinterns@uwe.nsa.gov for application questions. ***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Job Description

As an ALSAC intern, you will learn from experts who have helped us become one of America’s top healthcare charities while supporting the life-saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

  • Start Date: August 30, 2021

  • End Date: November 5, 2021

  • Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

  • Work Location: 100% Remote

Requirements:

  • A passion for our mission!

  • Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

  • Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

  • Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

  • Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

  • Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Data Science & Insights team provides actionable information that drives decision-making across the enterprise through statistical modeling and comprehensive data storytelling. They are also tasked with working across all of ALSAC to ensure analysts and business users have the tools, knowledge, and access to the data needed to make strategic decisions in their respective areas. Intern projects and tasks will range from helping build and improve existing data models that ALSAC leadership and decision makers consume to developing data visualizations, reports, and dashboards that synthesize large amounts of data using Tableau. Intern will also assist with documenting certified business processes and data sources using the Alation Data Catalog. The successful candidate may assist with project management, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, and report automation. Intern will take part in supporting the data science & insights team on individual projects that support overall decision making. Intern will document work procedures, processes, and methodologies for future use. Intern will also work closely with the Sr Data Analytics Liaison to create customized learning plan that focuses on his/her areas of interest.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interacting with business partners and ALSAC leadership to gather, interpret, and document requirements for various requests for analytical support

  • Working with Data Scientists to learn and understand the value of statistical models using Data Robot

  • Providing recommendations for process improvements regarding data analysis and research

  • Working with Data & Analytics Enablement team to create reports that simplify technical terms and processes using the Alation Data Catalog

  • Collaborating with Data Governance to assist in the decision making process around new data requests

  • Brainstorming and providing feedback on enterprise-wide Data Literacy efforts

  • Other duties as assigned

Majors preferred: Business Administration, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science

Technical Skills Preferred: SQL, Tableau, Machine Learning, Microsoft Office

Non-Technical Skills Preferred: Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, CURIOSITY.

Application & Interview Process:

After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • May require early morning or late night meetings to coordinate work assignments with our worldwide geographical development team.

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

We’re looking for someone in the midst of completing their Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python
  • Knowledge/Experience using web services: Spark, S3, RedShift, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL
  • Knowledge/Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Neo4J, Neptune, Cassandra, HBase and associated languages (Cypher, Gremlin)

Company Description:

Sikka Software is revolutionizing the field of retail healthcare software by providing the Sikka Platform Cloud which is seamlessly connected to over 400 combinations of practice management and financial systems covering over 96% of the dental, veterinary, audiology and optometry markets and provides a single application programming interface that anyone can build apps on. The company began with a simple vision, to help healthcare providers and small offices optimize their businesses via a series of easy-to-use cloud based applications through the Sikka Platform Cloud. The User Research Internship is a part-time, 6 month program that supports the academic growth of students enrolled in a college/university with an interest in the User Experience field, with the potential for full-time hire after graduation. Interns will gain practical, hands-on experience in various research methodologies, with a focus on survey creation, interviewing, usability testing, and screening/recruiting participants. Interns will work remotely for 20-25 hours per week on a set (but flexible) schedule.

Job Responsibilities

I. Prepare, Conduct, Analyze Research

  • Create surveys using Alchemer

  • Run usability tests and interview clients on the zoom/in person

  • Analyze quantitative and qualitative research

  • Prepare research readouts/decks that effectively communicate research findings to stakeholders

II. Recruit Research Participants

  • Work with User Researchers to determine target-user traits/criteria

  • Create screeners to ensure participants meet the criteria

  • Pull lists of clients who qualify for research

  • Support the workload of User Researchers & Recruiters as needed

Desired Research Experience

  • Experience conducting research in the social sciences or humanities

Our interns write real software and collaborate with a select group of experienced software development engineers (SDEs) who guide interns on projects that matter to our customers.

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security – just to name a few.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.

At the Alliance Innovation Lab – Silicon Valley (AIL–SV), we bring artificial intelligence (AI) to mobility. From developing autonomous driving systems to designing life on board experiences, our researchers apply AI technology to improve mobility for everybody. We are exploring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence and robotics, including sensing, perception, mapping, prediction, planning, decision making, and control, to lay the groundwork for the future of mobility.

We’re currently looking for a Artificial Intelligence Research Intern to join our team.

As part of the AI Research and Applications team, you will construct Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and Partially Observable MDPs (POMDPs) to solve complex decision-making scenarios in both autonomous vehicles (AVs) and intelligent vehicle systems. You will design new algorithms for learning and reasoning in that enable adaptation and provide scalability in while ensuring efficient, safe, and harmonious robot behavior.


Think you’ve got the internal drive to support the production of great vehicles and join a winning team? Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Apply for this position and start the process to kick your career into high gear.

During the course of your internship, you will have the chance to:

  • Develop and implement new MDPs and POMDPs as well as improve existing models.
  • Design, plan, and learn algorithms to solve these models for use in a wide array of scenarios.
  • Work with a team of world-leading experts in the fields of robotics, AI, trajectory planning, perception, and decision-making.
  • Write papers, reports, and patents, all towards publishing your research in academic conferences such as ICRA, IROS, RSS, AAAI, IJCAI, IV, and ITSC.

In order to qualify for this role, you must:

  • Currently be pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Aeronautics and Astronautics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with an emphasis on real-world AI and robotics
  • GPA of 3.0 or above
  • Experience with MDPs and POMDPs, ideally including solver algorithms, such as those based on MCTS or PBVI, in planning and/or learning contexts.
  • Experience with software development using C, C++, Python, and/or Julia.
  • Passion for doing research and development at the edge of human knowledge
  • Strong organization ability with keen attention to detail
  • Be self-motivated and willing to challenge yourself to develop your talents and skillsets
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral

Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:

  • Experience using Git in a collaborative software engineering team environment.
  • Experience working with ROS, ideally both in simulation using tools like rviz and running your code on a real robot.
  • Publications at top academic conferences in AI and robotics.
  • Experience working in industry, especially in the intersection of AI and robotics.
  • Experience working on autonomous vehicles, in simulated domains or in the real world.

We know you have the capability to change the world, and we want you to help us change the future of automotive.

We seek candidates who have the skills and research experience to join a new team to push the boundaries of pure mathematics, theoretical statistics (incl. parametric and non-parametric Bayesian statistics) and machine learning (primarily in deep reinforcement learning). A proven record of publications (at least one first-author paper in reputed conferences such as NeurIPS, COLT, UAI, ICML, AISTATS, JMLR, PAMI, and others) and prototyping skills in terms of developing algorithms, in any language, is critical.


As an industry R&D laboratory, we pursue theoretical and applied research to feed into the other. Like academia, knowledge dissemination is through the publication of papers in reputed journals, conferences and workshops, and patents. We have current collaborations with world-renowned academic institutions; encouraging such industry-academia partnerships is important for research scientists.


Qualifications, skills and other information:


  • Internship applicants will generally study towards a PhD degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, and allied disciplines. (core requirement)

  • Knowledge of Bayesian statistics (desirable)
  • Hands-on experience with at least one of the following: Python, C/C++, Java, etc. (core requirement)
  • REQUIRED: Concrete experience in reinforcement learning that goes beyond downloading an RL codebase and running it.
  • Data science and 'concrete' experience in RL are very different – the latter requires prowess both in mathematics and computer science, REQUIRED for this role. This difference is paramount. Someone who just has ML and Python on their CVs do not qualify them for RL.
  • Good candidates may have (a) published in the field of RL in top conferences i.e., original contribution, or (b) have a codebase that is original in GitHub/Bitbucket.

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems. At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers. The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen. ' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance. ' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022. ' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area. ' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

- Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level. - Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays. - Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs. - Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket. - Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed. - Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.

How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021. Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt. Applicant packages should include: ' Resume, ' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests, ' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and ' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted). Early Acceptance Incentive; The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period. If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail summerinterns@uwe.nsa.gov for application questions. ***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Data Science & Insights team provides actionable information that drives decision-making across the enterprise through statistical modeling and comprehensive data storytelling. They are also tasked with working across all of ALSAC to ensure analysts and business users have the tools, knowledge, and access to the data needed to make strategic decisions in their respective areas. Intern projects and tasks will range from helping build and improve existing data models that ALSAC leadership and decision makers consume to developing data visualizations, reports, and dashboards that synthesize large amounts of data using Tableau. Intern will also assist with documenting certified business processes and data sources using the Alation Data Catalog. The successful candidate may assist with project management, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, and report automation. Intern will take part in supporting the data science & insights team on individual projects that support overall decision making. Intern will document work procedures, processes, and methodologies for future use. Intern will also work closely with the Sr Data Analytics Liaison to create customized learning plan that focuses on his/her areas of interest.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interacting with business partners and ALSAC leadership to gather, interpret, and document requirements for various requests for analytical support

  • Working with Data Scientists to learn and understand the value of statistical models using Data Robot

  • Providing recommendations for process improvements regarding data analysis and research

  • Working with Data & Analytics Enablement team to create reports that simplify technical terms and processes using the Alation Data Catalog

  • Collaborating with Data Governance to assist in the decision making process around new data requests

  • Brainstorming and providing feedback on enterprise-wide Data Literacy efforts

  • Other duties as assigned

Majors preferred: Business Administration, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science

Technical Skills Preferred: SQL, Tableau, Machine Learning, Microsoft Office

Non-Technical Skills Preferred: Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, CURIOSITY.

Sony AI is seeking highly motivated, self-driven individuals with expertise in AI Ethics - specifically Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability (FTA). Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to research projects in AI ethics, especially around Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability.

  • Investigate new algorithms to solve fundamental AI ethics problems.

  • Write code to support research, usually in Python, C++, and/or R.

  • Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences.

  • Write papers for and give presentations at academic conferences.

Qualifications:

  • Passion to develop cutting-edge AI ethics technology and deploy it through a multi-stakeholder approach.

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills, including the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • May require early morning or late night meetings to coordinate work assignments with our worldwide geographical development team.

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

We’re looking for someone in the midst of completing their Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python
  • Knowledge/Experience using web services: Spark, S3, RedShift, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL
  • Knowledge/Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Neo4J, Neptune, Cassandra, HBase and associated languages (Cypher, Gremlin)

The User Research Internship is a part-time, 6 month program that supports the academic growth of students enrolled in a college/university with an interest in the User Experience field, with the potential for full-time hire after graduation. Interns will gain practical, hands-on experience in various research methodologies, with a focus on survey creation, interviewing, usability testing, and screening/recruiting participants. Interns will work remotely for 20-25 hours per week on a set (but flexible) schedule.

Job Responsibilities

I. Prepare, Conduct, Analyze Research

  • Create surveys using Alchemer

  • Run usability tests and interview clients on the zoom/in person

  • Analyze quantitative and qualitative research

  • Prepare research readouts/decks that effectively communicate research findings to stakeholders

II. Recruit Research Participants

  • Work with User Researchers to determine target-user traits/criteria

  • Create screeners to ensure participants meet the criteria

  • Pull lists of clients who qualify for research

  • Use Ethn.io tool to schedule the research meetings, most of which happen via Zoom

  • Schedule and invite team members to research sessions using Outlook

  • Compensate clients who have participated in a research study via our gift card platform

III. Support the User Research Team

  • Take detailed notes during research sessions and brainstorm meetings

  • Contact clients via email and phone to book research sessions in person or remotely

  • Support the workload of User Researchers & Recruiters as needed

Desired Research Experience

  • Experience conducting research in the social sciences or humanities

  • Experience analyzing/coding qualitative and/or quantitative data

  • Experience interviewing research participants

  • Experience building rapport with research participants

We’re looking for you to…

  • Be excited about User Experience Research and a drive to learn about the broader UX field

  • Be outgoing and very comfortable talking to clients on the phone/interviewing them

  • Be incredibly organized and capable of juggling multiple projects at the same time

  • Be self-driven, finding innovative ways to help the team when there is lull in your task load

  • Fully own research projects from start to finish, while keeping manager up-to-date on their status

  • Be proficient in Google Docs and Spreadsheets


Education

Be currently enrolled in a college/university, preferably in a UX or Research-related program (Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, Industrial Design)

• Currently enrolled in an Associate’s, Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
In addition to Computer Science and Computer Engineering, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or majors relating to these fields are considered

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our interns write real software and collaborate with a select group of experienced software development engineers (SDEs) who guide interns on projects that matter to our customers.

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security – just to name a few.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Many of our technologies overlap, and you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalize for customers.

Key Job Responsibilities

With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.

At the Alliance Innovation Lab – Silicon Valley (AIL–SV), we bring artificial intelligence (AI) to mobility. From developing autonomous driving systems to designing life on board experiences, our researchers apply AI technology to improve mobility for everybody. We are exploring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence and robotics, including sensing, perception, mapping, prediction, planning, decision making, and control, to lay the groundwork for the future of mobility.

We’re currently looking for a Artificial Intelligence Research Intern to join our team.

As part of the AI Research and Applications team, you will construct Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and Partially Observable MDPs (POMDPs) to solve complex decision-making scenarios in both autonomous vehicles (AVs) and intelligent vehicle systems. You will design new algorithms for learning and reasoning in that enable adaptation and provide scalability in while ensuring efficient, safe, and harmonious robot behavior.


Think you’ve got the internal drive to support the production of great vehicles and join a winning team? Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Apply for this position and start the process to kick your career into high gear.

During the course of your internship, you will have the chance to:

  • Develop and implement new MDPs and POMDPs as well as improve existing models.
  • Design, plan, and learn algorithms to solve these models for use in a wide array of scenarios.
  • Work with a team of world-leading experts in the fields of robotics, AI, trajectory planning, perception, and decision-making.
  • Write papers, reports, and patents, all towards publishing your research in academic conferences such as ICRA, IROS, RSS, AAAI, IJCAI, IV, and ITSC.

In order to qualify for this role, you must:

  • Currently be pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Aeronautics and Astronautics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with an emphasis on real-world AI and robotics
  • GPA of 3.0 or above
  • Experience with MDPs and POMDPs, ideally including solver algorithms, such as those based on MCTS or PBVI, in planning and/or learning contexts.
  • Experience with software development using C, C++, Python, and/or Julia.
  • Passion for doing research and development at the edge of human knowledge
  • Strong organization ability with keen attention to detail
  • Be self-motivated and willing to challenge yourself to develop your talents and skillsets
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral

Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:

  • Experience using Git in a collaborative software engineering team environment.
  • Experience working with ROS, ideally both in simulation using tools like rviz and running your code on a real robot.
  • Publications at top academic conferences in AI and robotics.
  • Experience working in industry, especially in the intersection of AI and robotics.
  • Experience working on autonomous vehicles, in simulated domains or in the real world.

We know you have the capability to change the world, and we want you to help us change the future of automotive.

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems. At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers. The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area. ' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

- Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level. - Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays. - Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs. - Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket. - Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed. - Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.

How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021. Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt. Applicant packages should include: ' Resume, ' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests, ' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and ' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted). Early Acceptance Incentive; The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period. If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail summerinterns@uwe.nsa.gov for application questions. ***PLEASE NOTE: U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph. This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

Job Description

As an ALSAC intern, you will learn from experts who have helped us become one of America’s top healthcare charities while supporting the life-saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

  • Start Date: August 30, 2021

  • End Date: November 5, 2021

  • Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

  • Work Location: 100% Remote

Requirements:

  • A passion for our mission!

  • Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

  • Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

  • Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

  • Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

  • Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Data Science & Insights team provides actionable information that drives decision-making across the enterprise through statistical modeling and comprehensive data storytelling. They are also tasked with working across all of ALSAC to ensure analysts and business users have the tools, knowledge, and access to the data needed to make strategic decisions in their respective areas. Intern projects and tasks will range from helping build and improve existing data models that ALSAC leadership and decision makers consume to developing data visualizations, reports, and dashboards that synthesize large amounts of data using Tableau. Intern will also assist with documenting certified business processes and data sources using the Alation Data Catalog. The successful candidate may assist with project management, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, and report automation. Intern will take part in supporting the data science & insights team on individual projects that support overall decision making. Intern will document work procedures, processes, and methodologies for future use. Intern will also work closely with the Sr Data Analytics Liaison to create customized learning plan that focuses on his/her areas of interest.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interacting with business partners and ALSAC leadership to gather, interpret, and document requirements for various requests for analytical support

  • Working with Data Scientists to learn and understand the value of statistical models using Data Robot

  • Providing recommendations for process improvements regarding data analysis and research

  • Working with Data & Analytics Enablement team to create reports that simplify technical terms and processes using the Alation Data Catalog

  • Collaborating with Data Governance to assist in the decision making process around new data requests

  • Brainstorming and providing feedback on enterprise-wide Data Literacy efforts

  • Other duties as assigned

Majors preferred: Business Administration, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science

Technical Skills Preferred: SQL, Tableau, Machine Learning, Microsoft Office

Non-Technical Skills Preferred: Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, CURIOSITY.

Application & Interview Process:

After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

For more information, visit stjude.org/alsacintern

  • Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences.
