position: Intern to support and serve the Black Community
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Roles

Cause: Serving the Black Community

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including nonprofits that meet the needs of the Black community.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

  • Professionals who want to volunteer part-time
  • "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders
  • Recent graduates, including international students on OPT
  • Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador
  • Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

  • Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.
  • Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.
  • Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Charities that Meet the Needs of the Black Community

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the Black community.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For Black Charities and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.
  • Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)
  • Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.
  • Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

  • Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.
  • Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.
  • Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.
  • Learn a tremendous amount.
  • Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.
  • Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.
  • Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

More Info and How to Apply

Please see https://ChangingThePresent.org/join for more information. To apply, please send a short cover note and resume to join[at]ChangingThePresent.org We will get back to you very quickly.

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

Thank you very much!

About Us:

We are PIMCO, a leading global asset management firm. We manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies and vehicles: fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds and private equity. PIMCO is one of the largest investment managers, actively managing more than $2.22 trillion in assets for clients around the world. PIMCO has over 3,000 employees in 20 offices globally. PIMCO is recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.

PIMCO is one of the world’s premier fixed income investment managers with thousands of professionals around the world united in a single purpose: creating opportunities for our clients in every environment. Since 1971, we have brought innovation and expertise to our partnership with the institutions, financial advisors and millions of individual investors who entrust us with their assets. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities.

Position Description:

Client Data Science Analyst, US


Positions are located in New York City, Newport Beach, CA or Austin, TX


See yourself as a Client Data Science Analyst:

Data Science internship opportunities at PIMCO occur within multiple departments. On the technology team, you’ll building tools and platforms to help portfolio managers leverage and analyze massive data sets to manage risk or search for alpha for clients. On the Client Solutions and Analytics team, you will focus on analyzing client data to create insights that bring investment ideas to clients. These are just two examples outlining the differences between departments.

You will work with a dynamic, global, growing market leader in a small fun group. Throughout the course of the summer, you’ll have a high level of exposure to the investment management business and will work with cutting edge technologies on new solutions.


The PIMCO Internship Experience:

  • The PIMCO Internship Program runs for 10 weeks beginning in early/mid-June 2022
  • During Week 1, you’ll participate in PIMCO Fundamentals Training, providing you with the skills, knowledge, and relationships that will prepare you for success
  • Alongside your colleagues, participate in PIMCO's Global Month of Volunteering, developed to heighten the impact of our employees' worldwide volunteer efforts
  • Join us for a variety of cross-divisional education, networking & social events!
  • Your supervisor, peer mentor, senior leaders and team offer guidance and mentorship throughout the summer
  • You’ll receive feedback at mid- and end-of-summer as part of a formal review process to keep you on the path to meeting your summer goals
  • Want to learn more? Hear about The PIMCO Internship Experience from past interns & search for live virtual recruiting events!
  • As a PIMCO intern, you’ll receive competitive compensation, along with a transition bonus to help with relocation to one of our office locations

How you should apply:

We review applications on a rolling basis and encourage you to apply by submitting your resume, cover letter & unofficial transcript as soon as you are ready.


What to expect during the interview process:

  • After we receive your application, we'll conduct an initial resume & cover letter review. We'll send status updates throughout the process.
  • You’ll showcase your interests, skills, and personality by completing a one-way video interview using the Spark Hire platform
  • If selected to move forward, you'll meet with us during final-round interviews conducted live via Webex. Interviews typically consist of behavioral and technical concepts.

PIMCO is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive, cognitively diverse environment.

For more information on PIMCO and Career Opportunities, please visit www.pimco.com/careers


Position Requirements:

You’re eligible to apply if you:
  • Are studying for a PhD, Master of Science or Bachelor of Science degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Financial Engineering or similar technical discipline
  • Have an expected graduation date of December 2022 – June 2024
  • Have a minimum 3.2 cumulative collegiate grade point average on a 4.0 scale (or the equivalent) at an accredited 4-year college or university
  • Are business proficient in English


You’ll excel as a PIMCO Data Science intern if you:
  • Have experience preparing large data sets from multiple sources. Are able to query relational data sets using SQL
  • Have strong programming skills in Python, Java and/or C#
  • Possess outstanding analytical skills with the ability to function efficiently and problem-solve in a fast paced and time-critical environment
  • Show outstanding communication skills which enable you to operate in a complex financial and technical environment
  • Show the following traits: ethical, collaborative, organized, flexible, high energy, self-starter, accountable, humble
  • Are comfortable working independently as well as in a collaborative team

Job Description

As an ALSAC intern, you will learn from experts who have helped us become one of America’s top healthcare charities while supporting the life-saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

  • Start Date: August 30, 2021

  • End Date: November 5, 2021

  • Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

  • Work Location: 100% Remote

Requirements:

  • A passion for our mission!

  • Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

  • Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

  • Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

  • Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

  • Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Data Science & Insights team provides actionable information that drives decision-making across the enterprise through statistical modeling and comprehensive data storytelling. They are also tasked with working across all of ALSAC to ensure analysts and business users have the tools, knowledge, and access to the data needed to make strategic decisions in their respective areas. Intern projects and tasks will range from helping build and improve existing data models that ALSAC leadership and decision makers consume to developing data visualizations, reports, and dashboards that synthesize large amounts of data using Tableau. Intern will also assist with documenting certified business processes and data sources using the Alation Data Catalog. The successful candidate may assist with project management, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, and report automation. Intern will take part in supporting the data science & insights team on individual projects that support overall decision making. Intern will document work procedures, processes, and methodologies for future use. Intern will also work closely with the Sr Data Analytics Liaison to create customized learning plan that focuses on his/her areas of interest.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interacting with business partners and ALSAC leadership to gather, interpret, and document requirements for various requests for analytical support

  • Working with Data Scientists to learn and understand the value of statistical models using Data Robot

  • Providing recommendations for process improvements regarding data analysis and research

  • Working with Data & Analytics Enablement team to create reports that simplify technical terms and processes using the Alation Data Catalog

  • Collaborating with Data Governance to assist in the decision making process around new data requests

  • Brainstorming and providing feedback on enterprise-wide Data Literacy efforts

  • Other duties as assigned

Majors preferred: Business Administration, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science

Technical Skills Preferred: SQL, Tableau, Machine Learning, Microsoft Office

Non-Technical Skills Preferred: Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, CURIOSITY.

Application & Interview Process:

After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

Every year, we welcome thousands of university students from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!

Responsibilities

Explore Microsoft is a 12-week summer internship program specifically designed for students in their first or second year of a bachelor’s degree program who would like to learn more about careers in software development through a learning program. Throughout the internship you will:

  • Gain hands-on experience with various tools and programming languages in the field of software development.
  • Work closely with your Manager and Mentors to evaluate requirements, estimate costs, create and implement features and services.
  • Experience both core tech disciplines (Program Manager and Software Engineer) during the 12-week internship.

Qualifications

  • Must be freshman (class of 2025) or sophomore (class of 2024) student, currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program within the United States, Canada or Mexico.
  • Demonstrated interest in majoring in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or related technical major.
  • Completed an Introduction to Computer Science course (or equivalent class) as well as one semester of calculus (or equivalent) by the start of the program.

Job description

Summary of Job Purpose:

Internship opportunity to work with a team to execute specific projects and receive on the job training while gaining professional experience.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
o This person will work with executive leadership to understand and define requirements of our leadership management system and process in order to tailor our IT tools to support simple, effective, and efficient monitoring and control of our key performance indicators (KPIs). Our management system includes a regular process to set goals, measure performance against those goals, and take action to control our performance. These KPIs include such things as sales, gross margin, R&D spend, staffing, on-time delivery, quality, and more.
o This work can be broken up into discrete projects, which can be started and completed during this internship.
o This position will also work with leadership to lay out the vision and roadmap of future expansion of the IT tools and management system to meet the business needs.
o This person will also work with others across different sites in Southern California, Texas, and Mexico to ensure their underlying KPI's are consumable by the IT tools for the Executive Leadership KPI's and management system.
o Current IT tools include SAP, Power BI, excel, powerpoint, and we welcome additional recommendations.
o This role will also include the rollout and training of users

Sony AI is seeking highly motivated, self-driven individuals with expertise in AI Ethics - specifically Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability (FTA). We are looking for smart, enthusiastic people who want to research, develop, and deploy FTA technology for real-world applications in various business areas.

Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to research projects in AI ethics, especially around Fairness, Transparency, and Accountability.

  • Work closely with a team of AI researchers and programmers in the U.S., Switzerland, and Japan on ambitious AI projects.

  • Investigate new algorithms to solve fundamental AI ethics problems.

  • Write code to support research, usually in Python, C++, and/or R.

  • Write reports and give presentations for internal audiences.

  • Write papers for and give presentations at academic conferences.

Qualifications:

  • Passion to develop cutting-edge AI ethics technology and deploy it through a multi-stakeholder approach.

  • Background in Machine Learning, ideally a current PhD student. Progress toward a degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related subjects is preferred, but we also welcome interdisciplinary researchers from other departments.

  • Experience in research on algorithmic fairness, accountability, and transparency, especially around detecting and mitigating bias in computer vision technologies, developing privacy-preserving technologies, and causal inference.

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills, including the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • May require early morning or late night meetings to coordinate work assignments with our worldwide geographical development team.

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.
  • Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques

We’re looking for someone in the midst of completing their Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field and is familiar with the following software/tools:

  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python
  • Knowledge/Experience using web services: Spark, S3, RedShift, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
  • Knowledge/Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, MySQL
  • Knowledge/Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Neo4J, Neptune, Cassandra, HBase and associated languages (Cypher, Gremlin)

Job Description

Intern, Software Developer – Simulation, Optimization and Systems team

This is a unique opportunity to work in a research group within an established, multi-national, high-end software company, in Toronto. Our work is forward looking and constantly changing.

Our projects and research deeply explore multidisciplinary problems in engineering, architecture, computer science, simulation, and design. Projects we are developing involve machine learning, computer vision, generative design, robotics, cloud computing, time series databases, sensor networks, big data navigation, and simulation.

The ideal candidate for this internship demonstrates an interest in computer graphics, cloud computing, machine learning and "big data" analytics, with a penchant for making the world a better place. Your role will depend to a large degree on your skills, aptitudes and interests.

Responsibilities

  • Architect, design, develop and implement software using a variety of languages and techniques

  • Work as part of a team of researchers, software developers, and product designers.

  • Participate in the iterative design process by quickly implementing prototypes.

  • Design and code production-quality applications and reusable software components

  • Research and develop new analytics and visualization techniques

  • Contribute to the technical expertise and research explorations

Preferred Qualifications

  • Fast learner, able to easily pick up different new technologies and run with them

  • Programming experience with Web technologies: HTML5, CSS, JS, node.js

  • Exposure to object-oriented programming with Java, C++, C#, or Python

  • Experience with RESTful APIs

  • Programming experience on various operating systems: Windows, Linux and OSX a plus

  • Ability to communicate effectively and work co-operatively

  • Self-motivated

  • Excellent communication skills, both oral and written

  • Basic programming experience with application frameworks

  • Experience with computer graphics; OpenGL, Direct3D are a plus

  • Experience with source code control such as git is desirable

  • Agile software development experience is a plus

The User Research Internship is a part-time, 6 month program that supports the academic growth of students enrolled in a college/university with an interest in the User Experience field, with the potential for full-time hire after graduation. Interns will gain practical, hands-on experience in various research methodologies, with a focus on survey creation, interviewing, usability testing, and screening/recruiting participants. Interns will work remotely for 20-25 hours per week on a set (but flexible) schedule.

Job Responsibilities

I. Prepare, Conduct, Analyze Research

  • Create surveys using Alchemer

  • Run usability tests and interview clients on the zoom/in person

  • Analyze quantitative and qualitative research

  • Prepare research readouts/decks that effectively communicate research findings to stakeholders

II. Recruit Research Participants

  • Work with User Researchers to determine target-user traits/criteria

  • Create screeners to ensure participants meet the criteria

  • Pull lists of clients who qualify for research

  • Use Ethn.io tool to schedule the research meetings, most of which happen via Zoom

  • Schedule and invite team members to research sessions using Outlook

  • Compensate clients who have participated in a research study via our gift card platform

III. Support the User Research Team

  • Take detailed notes during research sessions and brainstorm meetings

  • Contact clients via email and phone to book research sessions in person or remotely

  • Support the workload of User Researchers & Recruiters as needed

Desired Research Experience

  • Experience conducting research in the social sciences or humanities

  • Experience analyzing/coding qualitative and/or quantitative data

  • Experience interviewing research participants

  • Experience building rapport with research participants

We’re looking for you to…

  • Be excited about User Experience Research and a drive to learn about the broader UX field

  • Be outgoing and very comfortable talking to clients on the phone/interviewing them

  • Be incredibly organized and capable of juggling multiple projects at the same time

  • Be self-driven, finding innovative ways to help the team when there is lull in your task load

  • Fully own research projects from start to finish, while keeping manager up-to-date on their status

  • Be proficient in Google Docs and Spreadsheets


Education

Be currently enrolled in a college/university, preferably in a UX or Research-related program (Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, Industrial Design)

Description:

  • Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies.

You have strong communication and writing skills.


What You Can Expect from Us

We go beyond providing a competitive salary and benefits. We want our people to be successful – in work and in life. With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.

At the Alliance Innovation Lab – Silicon Valley (AIL–SV), we bring artificial intelligence (AI) to mobility. From developing autonomous driving systems to designing life on board experiences, our researchers apply AI technology to improve mobility for everybody. We are exploring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence and robotics, including sensing, perception, mapping, prediction, planning, decision making, and control, to lay the groundwork for the future of mobility.

We’re currently looking for a Artificial Intelligence Research Intern to join our team.

As part of the AI Research and Applications team, you will construct Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and Partially Observable MDPs (POMDPs) to solve complex decision-making scenarios in both autonomous vehicles (AVs) and intelligent vehicle systems. You will design new algorithms for learning and reasoning in that enable adaptation and provide scalability in while ensuring efficient, safe, and harmonious robot behavior.


Think you’ve got the internal drive to support the production of great vehicles and join a winning team? Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Apply for this position and start the process to kick your career into high gear.

During the course of your internship, you will have the chance to:

  • Develop and implement new MDPs and POMDPs as well as improve existing models.
  • Design, plan, and learn algorithms to solve these models for use in a wide array of scenarios.
  • Work with a team of world-leading experts in the fields of robotics, AI, trajectory planning, perception, and decision-making.
  • Write papers, reports, and patents, all towards publishing your research in academic conferences such as ICRA, IROS, RSS, AAAI, IJCAI, IV, and ITSC.

In order to qualify for this role, you must:

  • Currently be pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Aeronautics and Astronautics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with an emphasis on real-world AI and robotics
  • GPA of 3.0 or above
  • Experience with MDPs and POMDPs, ideally including solver algorithms, such as those based on MCTS or PBVI, in planning and/or learning contexts.
  • Experience with software development using C, C++, Python, and/or Julia.
  • Passion for doing research and development at the edge of human knowledge
  • Strong organization ability with keen attention to detail
  • Be self-motivated and willing to challenge yourself to develop your talents and skillsets
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral

Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:

  • Experience using Git in a collaborative software engineering team environment.
  • Experience working with ROS, ideally both in simulation using tools like rviz and running your code on a real robot.
  • Publications at top academic conferences in AI and robotics.
  • Experience working in industry, especially in the intersection of AI and robotics.
  • Experience working on autonomous vehicles, in simulated domains or in the real world.

We know you have the capability to change the world, and we want you to help us change the future of automotive.

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our interns write real software and collaborate with a select group of experienced software development engineers (SDEs) who guide interns on projects that matter to our customers.

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security – just to name a few.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Many of our technologies overlap, and you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalize for customers.

Key Job Responsibilities

  • Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment, and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
  • Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
  • Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
  • Ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.
  • Work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software.
Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates between May and June 2022. Applicants should have a minimum of one quarter/semester remaining in their studies after their internship concludes.

NOTE: By applying to this position your application will be considered for all locations we hire for in the United States. This includes, but is not limited to AZ (Phoenix, Tempe); CA (Berkeley, Culver City, Cupertino, East Palo Alto, Irvine, Los Angeles, Manhattan Beach, Palo Alto, San Francisco, San Jose, Santa Clara, Sunnyvale, San Diego, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, Santa Cruz, Santa Monica) CO (Boulder, Denver); GA (Atlanta, Kennesaw); MA (Boston, Cambridge, North Reading); MD (Baltimore); MI (Detroit); MN (Minneapolis); NJ (Jersey City); NY (New York); OR (Portland); PA (Philadelphia, Pittsburg); TN (Nashville); TX (Austin, Dallas); VA (Arlington, Herndon); WI (Madison), WA (Bellevue, Seattle, Redmond). Locations are subject to change.

position: Intern to support and serve the Black Community
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Roles

Cause: Serving the Black Community

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including nonprofits that meet the needs of the Black community.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

  • Professionals who want to volunteer part-time
  • "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders
  • Recent graduates, including international students on OPT
  • Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador
  • Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

  • Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.
  • Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.
  • Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Charities that Meet the Needs of the Black Community

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the Black community.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For Black Charities and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.
  • Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)
  • Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.
  • Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

  • Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.
  • Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

About Us:

We are PIMCO, a leading global asset management firm. We manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies and vehicles: fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds and private equity. PIMCO is one of the largest investment managers, actively managing more than $2.22 trillion in assets for clients around the world. PIMCO has over 3,000 employees in 20 offices globally. PIMCO is recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.

PIMCO is one of the world’s premier fixed income investment managers with thousands of professionals around the world united in a single purpose: creating opportunities for our clients in every environment. Since 1971, we have brought innovation and expertise to our partnership with the institutions, financial advisors and millions of individual investors who entrust us with their assets. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities.

Position Description:

Client Data Science Analyst, US


Positions are located in New York City, Newport Beach, CA or Austin, TX


See yourself as a Client Data Science Analyst:

Data Science internship opportunities at PIMCO occur within multiple departments. On the technology team, you’ll building tools and platforms to help portfolio managers leverage and analyze massive data sets to manage risk or search for alpha for clients. On the Client Solutions and Analytics team, you will focus on analyzing client data to create insights that bring investment ideas to clients. These are just two examples outlining the differences between departments.

You will work with a dynamic, global, growing market leader in a small fun group. Throughout the course of the summer, you’ll have a high level of exposure to the investment management business and will work with cutting edge technologies on new solutions.


The PIMCO Internship Experience:

  • The PIMCO Internship Program runs for 10 weeks beginning in early/mid-June 2022
  • During Week 1, you’ll participate in PIMCO Fundamentals Training, providing you with the skills, knowledge, and relationships that will prepare you for success
  • Alongside your colleagues, participate in PIMCO's Global Month of Volunteering, developed to heighten the impact of our employees' worldwide volunteer efforts
  • Join us for a variety of cross-divisional education, networking & social events!
  • Your supervisor, peer mentor, senior leaders and team offer guidance and mentorship throughout the summer
  • You’ll receive feedback at mid- and end-of-summer as part of a formal review process to keep you on the path to meeting your summer goals
  • Want to learn more? Hear about The PIMCO Internship Experience from past interns & search for live virtual recruiting events!
  • As a PIMCO intern, you’ll receive competitive compensation, along with a transition bonus to help with relocation to one of our office locations

How you should apply:

We review applications on a rolling basis and encourage you to apply by submitting your resume, cover letter & unofficial transcript as soon as you are ready.


What to expect during the interview process:

  • After we receive your application, we'll conduct an initial resume & cover letter review. We'll send status updates throughout the process.
  • You’ll showcase your interests, skills, and personality by completing a one-way video interview using the Spark Hire platform
  • If selected to move forward, you'll meet with us during final-round interviews conducted live via Webex. Interviews typically consist of behavioral and technical concepts.

PIMCO is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive, cognitively diverse environment.

For more information on PIMCO and Career Opportunities, please visit www.pimco.com/careers


Position Requirements:

You’re eligible to apply if you:
  • Are studying for a PhD, Master of Science or Bachelor of Science degree in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science, Engineering, Financial Engineering or similar technical discipline
  • Have an expected graduation date of December 2022 – June 2024
  • Have a minimum 3.2 cumulative collegiate grade point average on a 4.0 scale (or the equivalent) at an accredited 4-year college or university
  • Are business proficient in English


You’ll excel as a PIMCO Data Science intern if you:
  • Have experience preparing large data sets from multiple sources. Are able to query relational data sets using SQL
  • Have strong programming skills in Python, Java and/or C#
  • Possess outstanding analytical skills with the ability to function efficiently and problem-solve in a fast paced and time-critical environment
  • Show outstanding communication skills which enable you to operate in a complex financial and technical environment
  • Show the following traits: ethical, collaborative, organized, flexible, high energy, self-starter, accountable, humble
  • Are comfortable working independently as well as in a collaborative team

Job Description

As an ALSAC intern, you will learn from experts who have helped us become one of America’s top healthcare charities while supporting the life-saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Our fall program offers a 10 week fully immersed experience. You will be assigned a day to day manager in your industry and our program manager will lead you with networking and professional development events.

  • Start Date: August 30, 2021

  • End Date: November 5, 2021

  • Hours: 20 hours a week (Monday-Friday)

  • Pay Rate: All ALSAC interns are paid. Pay rate is based on work location.

  • Work Location: 100% Remote

Requirements:

  • A passion for our mission!

  • Must be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university and in good standing.

  • Must be comfortable with Zoom and Microsoft Office products including Word, Excel, and Power Point.

  • Ability to work in a team environment but also work strong independently.

  • Ability to be organized and detailed to balance several projects simultaneously.

  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality.

  • Must be 18 years of age or older.

Specific Internship Description and Preferred Skills:

The Data Science & Insights team provides actionable information that drives decision-making across the enterprise through statistical modeling and comprehensive data storytelling. They are also tasked with working across all of ALSAC to ensure analysts and business users have the tools, knowledge, and access to the data needed to make strategic decisions in their respective areas. Intern projects and tasks will range from helping build and improve existing data models that ALSAC leadership and decision makers consume to developing data visualizations, reports, and dashboards that synthesize large amounts of data using Tableau. Intern will also assist with documenting certified business processes and data sources using the Alation Data Catalog. The successful candidate may assist with project management, process mapping, data analysis, workflow documentation, and report automation. Intern will take part in supporting the data science & insights team on individual projects that support overall decision making. Intern will document work procedures, processes, and methodologies for future use. Intern will also work closely with the Sr Data Analytics Liaison to create customized learning plan that focuses on his/her areas of interest.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Interacting with business partners and ALSAC leadership to gather, interpret, and document requirements for various requests for analytical support

  • Working with Data Scientists to learn and understand the value of statistical models using Data Robot

  • Providing recommendations for process improvements regarding data analysis and research

  • Working with Data & Analytics Enablement team to create reports that simplify technical terms and processes using the Alation Data Catalog

  • Collaborating with Data Governance to assist in the decision making process around new data requests

  • Brainstorming and providing feedback on enterprise-wide Data Literacy efforts

  • Other duties as assigned

Majors preferred: Business Administration, MIS, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science

Technical Skills Preferred: SQL, Tableau, Machine Learning, Microsoft Office

Non-Technical Skills Preferred: Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, Good written and verbal communication skills, detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, CURIOSITY.

Application & Interview Process:

After you submit your application and if you meet requirements, you will be sent an email to complete a virtual video interview from HireVue. Your submission will be reviewed and if you are selected to move forward, you will be contacted for a Zoom interview with the hiring manger. Final candidates will be selected by August 20, 2021.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing cloud data.

This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new multi-disciplined team of experienced individuals who will be driving the solution design, development, and deployment of advanced machine learning solutions supporting the company’s digital medicine program and other mobile health applications.

The position is within Sikka Artificial Intelligence Lab’s team, which contributes to our autonomous diagnosis, health outcomes and inferencing technology strategy as well as our self-driving practice initiative.

The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, from databasing and APIs to user engagement data. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights into machine learning techniques focused on classification, supervised learning, reinforced learning and eventually deep learning
  • Produce new and creative ML solutions in a landscape may include neural networks, with specific interest and emphasis on classification, supervised and unsupervised learning leading to deep learning systems, computer vision, human-computer interaction
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • May require early morning or late night meetings to coordinate work assignments with our worldwide geographical development team.

Desired technical expertise:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
  • Experience working with and creating data architectures.

The User Research Internship is a part-time, 6 month program that supports the academic growth of students enrolled in a college/university with an interest in the User Experience field, with the potential for full-time hire after graduation. Interns will gain practical, hands-on experience in various research methodologies, with a focus on survey creation, interviewing, usability testing, and screening/recruiting participants. Interns will work remotely for 20-25 hours per week on a set (but flexible) schedule.

Job Responsibilities

I. Prepare, Conduct, Analyze Research

  • Create surveys using Alchemer

  • Run usability tests and interview clients on the zoom/in person

  • Analyze quantitative and qualitative research

  • Prepare research readouts/decks that effectively communicate research findings to stakeholders

II. Recruit Research Participants

  • Work with User Researchers to determine target-user traits/criteria

  • Create screeners to ensure participants meet the criteria

  • Pull lists of clients who qualify for research

  • Use Ethn.io tool to schedule the research meetings, most of which happen via Zoom

  • Schedule and invite team members to research sessions using Outlook

  • Compensate clients who have participated in a research study via our gift card platform

III. Support the User Research Team

  • Take detailed notes during research sessions and brainstorm meetings

  • Contact clients via email and phone to book research sessions in person or remotely

  • Support the workload of User Researchers & Recruiters as needed

Desired Research Experience

  • Experience conducting research in the social sciences or humanities

  • Experience analyzing/coding qualitative and/or quantitative data

  • Experience interviewing research participants

  • Experience building rapport with research participants

We’re looking for you to…

  • Be excited about User Experience Research and a drive to learn about the broader UX field

  • Be outgoing and very comfortable talking to clients on the phone/interviewing them

  • Be incredibly organized and capable of juggling multiple projects at the same time

  • Be self-driven, finding innovative ways to help the team when there is lull in your task load

  • Fully own research projects from start to finish, while keeping manager up-to-date on their status

  • Be proficient in Google Docs and Spreadsheets


Education

Be currently enrolled in a college/university, preferably in a UX or Research-related program (Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Computer Science, Graphic Design, Industrial Design)

What You Can Expect from Us

We go beyond providing a competitive salary and benefits. We want our people to be successful – in work and in life. With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.

At the Alliance Innovation Lab – Silicon Valley (AIL–SV), we bring artificial intelligence (AI) to mobility. From developing autonomous driving systems to designing life on board experiences, our researchers apply AI technology to improve mobility for everybody. We are exploring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence and robotics, including sensing, perception, mapping, prediction, planning, decision making, and control, to lay the groundwork for the future of mobility.

We’re currently looking for a Artificial Intelligence Research Intern to join our team.

As part of the AI Research and Applications team, you will construct Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and Partially Observable MDPs (POMDPs) to solve complex decision-making scenarios in both autonomous vehicles (AVs) and intelligent vehicle systems. You will design new algorithms for learning and reasoning in that enable adaptation and provide scalability in while ensuring efficient, safe, and harmonious robot behavior.


Think you’ve got the internal drive to support the production of great vehicles and join a winning team? Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Apply for this position and start the process to kick your career into high gear.

During the course of your internship, you will have the chance to:

  • Develop and implement new MDPs and POMDPs as well as improve existing models.
  • Design, plan, and learn algorithms to solve these models for use in a wide array of scenarios.
  • Work with a team of world-leading experts in the fields of robotics, AI, trajectory planning, perception, and decision-making.
  • Write papers, reports, and patents, all towards publishing your research in academic conferences such as ICRA, IROS, RSS, AAAI, IJCAI, IV, and ITSC.

In order to qualify for this role, you must:

  • Currently be pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Aeronautics and Astronautics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with an emphasis on real-world AI and robotics
  • GPA of 3.0 or above
  • Experience with MDPs and POMDPs, ideally including solver algorithms, such as those based on MCTS or PBVI, in planning and/or learning contexts.
  • Experience with software development using C, C++, Python, and/or Julia.
  • Passion for doing research and development at the edge of human knowledge
  • Strong organization ability with keen attention to detail
  • Be self-motivated and willing to challenge yourself to develop your talents and skillsets
  • Strong communication skills both written and oral

Ways to Stand Out from The Crowd:

  • Experience using Git in a collaborative software engineering team environment.
  • Experience working with ROS, ideally both in simulation using tools like rviz and running your code on a real robot.
  • Publications at top academic conferences in AI and robotics.
  • Experience working in industry, especially in the intersection of AI and robotics.
  • Experience working on autonomous vehicles, in simulated domains or in the real world.

We know you have the capability to change the world, and we want you to help us change the future of automotive.

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Our interns write real software and collaborate with a select group of experienced software development engineers (SDEs) who guide interns on projects that matter to our customers.

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution of Amazon technology and lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security – just to name a few.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in activities with other interns throughout your internship. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real-world setting. Many of our technologies overlap, and you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalize for customers.

Key Job Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring innovative products and services to market.
  • Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment, and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
  • Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed.
  • Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
  • Ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.
  • Work in an agile environment to deliver high-quality software.

position: Intern to support and serve the Black Community
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Roles

Cause: Serving the Black Community

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including nonprofits that meet the needs of the Black community.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

  • Professionals who want to volunteer part-time
  • "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders
  • Recent graduates, including international students on OPT
  • Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador
  • Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

  • Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.
  • Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.
  • Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Charities that Meet the Needs of the Black Community

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the Black community.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For Black Charities and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.
  • Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.
  • Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)
  • Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.
  • Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

  • Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.
  • Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.
  • Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.
  • Learn a tremendous amount.
  • Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.
  • Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.
  • Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

More Info and How to Apply

Please see https://ChangingThePresent.org/join for more information. To apply, please send a short cover note and resume to join[at]ChangingThePresent.org We will get back to you very quickly.

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

Thank you very much!

General Information

Functional Area: Internships
